wikipedia_page.main: David Alastair Pearson Anderson, 2nd Viscount Waverley (18 February 1911 – 21 February 1990) was a British peer and physician. He trained as a physician in Germany and England, served in the Royal Air Force during the Second World War, and then specialised as a cardiologist. Having succeeded his father as Viscount Waverley in 1958, he also sat in the House of Lords where he regularly spoke on health matter and other interests of his.

response: *David Anderson, 2nd Viscount Waverley (1911–1990), British peer and physician
* David Anderson, 2nd Viscount Waverley (1911 – 1990), British cardiologist and member of the House of Lords
